about_the_game:
Warning: This is probably the hardest golf video game you will ever attempt to play.

An Other Golf Game is not your typical openish world sandbox life-sim survival golf game experience featuring permadeath. You'll learn the art of golf on your own terms: picking clubs, assessing the wind, and, of course, tracking down that stray ball no matter where it lands. It’s a game for those who want to discover, adapt, and make every inch of progress on their own.

Beyond the golf course, life goes on—literally. You're living out entire days, where golfing may or may not be part of it, it's entirely up to you. You’ll have to keep yourself alive, managing food, water, and sleep while earning enough cash through odd jobs to keep your golfing dream alive.

It’s a game that tests patience, resourcefulness, and adaptability. If you’re willing to roll with the quirks, laugh off the Early Access growing pains, you might just discover an experience that’s both unexpectedly rewarding and thoroughly unconventional.

Welcome to An Other Golf Game. Good luck out there, and happy golfing… if you can survive long enough to get to it!

Featuring

☺︎...Very few instructions or clarity, featuring no tutorials, and no plans to have them

☺︎...Golfing, but without the bad parts removed

☺︎...Living

☺︎...Permadeath

☺︎...Radios with multiple channels and custom station

☺︎...Immersion, 1st human only

☺︎...A hand sculpted ~4km x ~4km world

☺︎...Multiple drivable vehicles+

☺︎...Local golf course (The Oaks Bend)

☺︎...Local golf course bar (The Soggy Oak)

☺︎...Bar TV

☺︎...NPC Vehicles and interactions+

☺︎...Jobs+

☺︎...2nd ~Hidden short course

☺︎...Dynamic wind

☺︎...Touching grass

☺︎...Currency

☺︎...Player stats

☺︎...Club stats

☺︎...Ball stats

☺︎...Urgent Care

☺︎...Full Day/Night

☺︎...Driving range, working ball machine

☺︎...Road systems, highway, dirt, street, cart paths, etc

☺︎...Pro shop various products

☺︎...Town

☺︎...Gas station with gas pump

☺︎...Towing

☺︎...Menus/Save system

☺︎...Steam achievements

☺︎...Ambiance

☺︎...Post life high score screen

☺︎...Tournament*

☺︎...Caddy job*

☺︎...Wine Bar*

☺︎...Rain*

☺︎...Bar Arcade Game*

☺︎...and more!

* things that are not in the game whatsoever yet

+ currently available with more to be added and improvements coming

♥ Transparency Section

This is my first game. I am making it by myself. Everything needs polishing. I promise you will die relentlessly to bad physics and weird bugs, lose multiple clubs in the ground and even have your car door kill you. You may never even find the golf course, I am sure many of you will quit before you spend the time to find it. This is as much a puzzle, as it is a life sim, as it is a golf game.

WARNING: RIGHT HAND PERSPECTIVE ONLY. The player is actually left handed, and they learned to golf right handed. That said, if you're left handed, sorry. But, actually, technically you will be getting the full experience, so, I guess it is a... you're welcome.

I am excited to continue the work on this project to make the entire experience more refined and of course add the missing features some of which are detailed above. Thanks for your patience. I also expect early access to quickly shine light on any potential bugs that have gone unnoticed in the playtests, please consider joining the discord to report any issues you experience. I will try to address things in a timely manner. <3

content_descriptors.notes: The game, though primarily a golf experience, includes elements of cartoonish death and violence. Additionally, the game features mature colorful language.

name: An Other Golf Game

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GTX 1080 or AMD equivalent
  • Storage: 4 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i7
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia 3060
  • Storage: 4 GB available space

short_description: Suck at golf virtually as much as you suck in real life. Try to enjoy this tastefully frustrating openish world sandbox life simulator survival permadeath golf experience.
